stream_context.summary: Kaze live-codes Course 15 (rocket/space area) of Return to Yoshi’s Island, demonstrates the nearly-finished tentacle Yoshi boss, fixes a smoke VFX bug, and brainstorms a major redesign—turning the boss arena into a break-away planet.  He also lays out a Mario-64–style “retro section,” discusses memory/ROM limits, and chats with team members about art, animation and music.

development_findings.summary: All 15 main courses are almost complete; Course 15 only needs one sub-area and polish before the team moves to a general polishing phase.
development_findings.quote: "After that we have one more sub-area to do in course 15 and we're finally done. All the main courses will be finished."

development_findings.summary: Current Course 15 boss: a mutated Yoshi with tentacles that slam, spawn baby Yoshis, and require popping mushroom-like growths.  Difficulty is high due to overlapping tentacles and excessive minions, which Kaze will tune.
Original ‘tumors’ on the boss were replaced with mushrooms after feedback that tumors were too disgusting.
development_findings.quote: "I had him grow tumors… someone said this is way too disgusting, so I changed the tumors into mushrooms."

development_findings.summary: New arena concept: replace the factory interior with a small planet.  Trigger cutscene when Mario lands on a ring; Yoshi drills/Beyblades and shears off the planet’s top half, leaving a hemispherical arena with a hazardous core.  Lower poly and visually impressive.
Inside-rocket sub-area layout finished: computer room, specimen tanks, low-gravity shaft, engine room with hot pipes, observatory with holograms, glass-dome star tease to "edge the player."
Hot-panel tiles now heat/cool periodically; Kaze fixed missing burn-smoke by correcting a struct size and layer definition, and made the emitter camera-culled for performance.

Retro section for Course 15 will be a Mario 64 homage made of floating snippets: Bob-omb Bridge, Whomp’s tower, JRB beach/boat, CCM cabin & snowman, Big Boo’s mansion, HMC toxic maze, SSL pillar jumps, TTM slide, THI windy mountain, ending with Rainbow Ride carpet.  Memory budget checked (~0.5 MB free).
ROM currently 58.8 MB; target 64 MB, so assets still fit on a single N64 cartridge image.
New rain shader implemented (textured sheets) and demonstrates better performance vs previous particles.
Rare crash during BLJ discovered; cause unknown—likely action-state loop; flagged for later debugging.
Guest authors Hazer and Martiste are contributing small side levels; Hazer’s pastel ‘wind/flower slide’ demo shown.

context_findings.summary: Kaze pays a freelancer $5 per YouTube Short; finds them “cringe” but amusing.
Strong stance against option-creep; refuses to add excessive toggles that bloat menus.
context_findings.quote: "People always ask for more and more options… I'd have an options menu with 260 items. Reading this option is not worth the time in my life."

context_findings.summary: Philosophy on asset reuse: anyone may use his assets if they can extract them without his help; he won’t provide support.
context_findings.quote: "If you are able to use my stuff without my help, then you're free to use it."

context_findings.summary: Personal notes: feels sick; parents visiting to see the baby; wife Zeina working nearby.
Complains about NVIDIA Broadcast update and Parallel N64 emulator breaking his demo.
Prefers PayPal donations over YouTube due to lower fees but risks missing alerts.

biobak.summary: Provides graphics feedback (UV issues, hologram praise) and will revise the Yoshi boss model before full import.
Reminded Kaze about layer-five change (transparent decal) which helped diagnose smoke bug.

badub.summary: Will compose music for retro section; Kaze "looking forward to Badub’s matchup."

zeina.summary: Animating baby Yoshi minions for the boss; currently look like “brain-dead zombies.”
Mentioned off-screen doing something "weird" while Kaze streamed; personal rapport noted.

key_stories.title: Tumors to Mushrooms
key_stories.summary: The boss originally sprouted grotesque tumors, but external feedback labeled it too disgusting.  Kaze swapped them for more whimsical mushrooms.
key_stories.challenge: Balance body-horror theme without alienating players.
key_stories.process: Showed early model, received negative reaction, re-textured growths as mushrooms.
key_stories.outcome: Visual now reads as creepy but playful, fitting Yoshi aesthetic.
key_stories.key_quote: I changed the tumors into mushrooms that grow out of the Yoshi and I think the mushrooms are a little less traumatizing.

key_stories.title: Planet Arena Pivot
key_stories.summary: Chat suggested replacing the crowded factory arena with a dramatic small planet that Yoshi cracks in half.
key_stories.challenge: Current factory layout felt dull and high-poly; fight readability and performance issues.
key_stories.process: Live brainstorm: ring trigger, drill/Beyblade animation, debris VFX, hazardous core.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze wrote the concept into task list and committed to scrapping factory for planet idea.
key_stories.key_quote: Instead of the factory, the Yoshi fight happens on an egg-planet.

key_stories.title: Smoke VFX Bug Hunt
key_stories.summary: Burn-smoke on hot panels failed to render.
key_stories.challenge: Missing particle effect reduced feedback for new hazard.
key_stories.process: Tested other effects, realized struct size changed; fixed emitter and added camera-culling.
key_stories.outcome: Smoke now spawns correctly and with better performance.
key_stories.key_quote: That was the issue—it needs to spawn a lot more than that.

open_questions.context: Kaze floated ideas (Bowser mech, Bowser with Yoshi powers) but said nothing is decided.
questions: What narrative and gameplay goals guide the final boss?
Is the team leaning toward a Yoshi-built superweapon, Bowser mech, or something new?
How will each contributor (art, music, animation) shape this encounter?

open_questions.context: Backward long jump occasionally crashes; Kaze suspects action-state loop but hasn’t debugged.
questions: What specific conditions trigger the crash?
Which recent engine changes could affect action states?
Has anyone else on the team replicated the bug?

open_questions.context: Needs convincing low-poly destruction; options include drill, portal, debris.
questions: What technical method will be used to split the planet mesh and animate debris?
Can N64 hardware handle dynamic mesh separation or will pre-baked models be swapped?
How will Zeina’s animations sync with the destruction?
What musical cue will Badub provide for the cutscene?

open_questions.context: Floating snippets concept approved but memory and performance remain estimates.
questions: Will each snippet keep original scale or be resized?
How will transitions between disjoint chunks be communicated to players?
Does the 0.5 MB free RAM truly cover all additional geometry and textures?
